All travelers shall likewise be handed out a health advisory pamphlet upon departure.- Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs), students studying in South Korea, and those with Permanent Resident status are not restricted to travel into South Korea.- OFWs (whether returning or newly-hired) as well as dependents of permanent residents are allowed to return to South Korea but they must also execute a Declaration signifying their knowledge and understanding of the risks involved upon their return to the country.

description:
March 22, 2021 to April 21, 2021 the Philippine government has suspended the entry of all foreign nationals. The number of inbound international passengers has been limited to 1,500 per day.

The following are exempt from entry ban: Diplomats and members of international organizations, and their dependents who hold valid 9(e) visa or 47(a)(2) visa,  foreign nationals involved in medical repatriation duly endorsed by Department of Foreign Affairs – Office of the Undersecretary for Migrant Workers Affairs and Overseas Workers Welfare Administration who hold a valid visa, foreign seafarers under the “Green Lanes” program for crew change, provided that they hold a 9(c) crew list visa, foreign spouses and children of Filipino citizens travelling with the Filipino citizen who hold a valid visa, emergency, humanitarian, and other analogous cases approved by the Chairperson of the NTF COVID-19 or his duly authorized representative, provided the foreign nationals have valid visas at the time of entry.

description: On Monday (16 March), the Philippine President announced that the inhabitants of the island of Luzon, on which the capital Manila is also located, may only leave their houses for shopping. The workers of some industries are still allowed to go to work. description: From July 20, 2020 Philippine authorities introduced new measures including undergoing COVID-19 testing and mandatory quarantine on return to the country. Passengers arriving at Francisco Bangoy International Airport (DVO), which serves Davao City, are required to submit a negative reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) test, taken within 48 hours of their departure. Those arriving at DVO without the required test will not be permitted to leave the airport until testing has been arranged. The measure was introduced by the Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP) in an effort to curb the spread of the coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

Travelers are responsible for their accommodation and food expenses during their stay and must complete a 14-day quarantine/self-isolation upon returning home.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: President Rodrigo Duterte announced on Monday, August 31 (2020), that Metro Manila (Philippines) would remain under general community quarantine (GCQ) until September 30 (2020) due to the ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic.

type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine

description: On January 23, 2021 the Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases  IATF-EID of the Philippine Government had implemented stricter testing protocol for travelers arriving from countries with cases of the new coronavirus disease 2019  COVID-19 variant. The mandatory completion of the 14-day facility-based quarantine will be replaced with testing the passengers upon arrival then another test during their fifth day of quarantine. If their second swab test yields a negative result, they can be sent home. It was not specified however how long the quarantine would be for those travelers yielding positive results in the second round of tests.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On January 28, 2021, According to Philippine Government, Foreign nationals entering the Philippines must pre-book accommodations at an accredited quarantine hotel/facility for at least 7 nights. They will be subject to testing on the 6th day of arrival.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective February 1, 2021, according to Philippine Government all arriving passengers, regardless of origin, shall be required to undergo facility-based quarantine upon arrival.Unless the passenger exhibits symptoms at an earlier date while on quarantine, a RT-PCR test shall be conducted on the fifth day after arrival. If negative, the passenger may leave the facility and continue monitored 14 day quarantine at their destination.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As of February 9, 2021 The Philippines is currently limiting the entry of U.S citizens and foreign nationals into the country.  Pre-booked quarantine facility and pre-booked COVID-19 testing at a laboratory operating at the airport are required for these visitors. All travelers arriving in the Philippines are required to undergo a COVID-19 swab test 5 days after their arrival and while on quarantine. Travelers need to fill out health declaration cards and must submit to thermal scanning and medical assessment at the airport. While waiting for the results of their tests, travelers are required to stay in approved stringent quarantine facilities or Bureau of Quarantine (BOQ) approved quarantine hotels.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In the Philippines, under enhanced community quarantine, "No hotels or similar establishments shall be allowed to operate"except those
accommodating the following: For guests who have existing booking accommodations for foreigners as of 17 March 2020 for Luzon and 01 May 2020 for other areas Guests who have existing long-term bookings;
Distressed Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs) and stranded Filipinos or foreign nationals; Repatriated OFWs in compliance with approved quarantine protocols; Non-OFWs who may be required to undergo mandatory facility-based quarantine; and Health care workers and other employees from exempted establishments under these Omnibus Guidelines and applicable Memoranda from the Executive
Secretary.

description: In the Philippines, under modified enhanced community quarantine, Hotels or similar establishments shall not be allowed to operate, except those accommodating the following: For guests who have existing booking accommodations for foreigners as of 17 March 2020 for Luzon and 01 May 2020 for other areas; Guests who have existing long-term bookings; Distressed OF Ws and stranded Filipinos or foreign nationals; Repatriated OFWs in compliance with approved quarantine protocols; Non-OFWs who may be required to undergo mandatory facility-based quarantine; and Health care workers and other employees, whether private or public, from exempted establishments under these Omnibus Guidelines and applicable Memoranda from the Executive Secretary. Provided that in all of the foregoing, hotel operations shall be limited to the provision of basic accommodation services to guests through an in-house skeleton workforce. Ancillary establishments within the premises, such as restaurants, cafés, bars, gyms, spas, and the like, shall not be allowed to operate or to provide room service; Provided further, that accommodation establishments may prepare: (a) packed meals for distribution to guests who opt for the same; and (b) food orders for take-out and delivery only.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description:
In the Philippines, under General Community Quarantine, "Limited operations in malls and shopping centers shall be allowed, except for leisure establishments and services which shall continue to be closed. Provided, that establishments and services allowed to operate in malls and shopping centers may only operate at a capacity consistent with Section 2(4) of these Omnibus Guidelines. Provided, further, those below twenty-one (21) years old, and those sixty (60) years old
and above and those with immunodeficiency, comorbidity, or other health risks, and pregnant women, including any person who resides with the aforementioned, may not enter malls and shopping centers except when indispensable under the circumstances for
obtaining essential goods and services or for work in establishments located therein until otherwise modified through subsequent issuances of the IATF. Provided, finally, that operations of malls and shopping centers are subject to the guidelines of the DTI."
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: According to the Manila city government, the following events are postponed while authorities prepare for the quarantine - “Diwa ng Bahaghari,” a sexual orientation and gender identity seminar workshop scheduled on March 14; the premier of the Philippine Education Theater Association’s “Under My Skin” on March 19; HIV testing and seminar on March 27; the “Viva Manila Concert,” a rock n’ roll international marathon on March 31; a Sogie seminar workshop on April 3 to 4; and the Manila Summer Pride on April 19. description:
In the Philippines, under enhaced community quarantine, mass gatherings such as but not limited to, movie screenings, concerts, sporting events, and other entertainment activities, community assemblies, religious gatherings, and non-essential work gatherings shall be prohibited. allowed. UPDATE: The original policy did not exclude public transporation, public transportation face between excluded from the restriction of mass gathering
